results.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sam Spiegel, Columbia, Horizon (US), Horizon (GB) and David Lean
results.brief_description: Hailed as the greatest war film and distinguished by a visual and narrative sweep rare in modern cinema, David Lean’s masterpiece combines a relentless battle of wills with unparalleled action and spectacle. Based on Pierre Boulle’s best seller and starring Alec Guinness, William Holden and Jack Hawkins, this is the gripping tale of British POWs, captured by the Japanese in World War II and ordered to build a bridge to accommodate the Burma-Siam Railway. Honoured with 7 Academy Awards including Best Picture, Best Actor (Alec Guinness) and Best Director, this film continues to be one of the most memorable cinematic experiences. The bridge demolition scene remains a brilliant piece of stunt photography.

results.title: The Bridge
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Jo Kennedy
results.brief_description: Danny Craven lives in Launching Place, a quiet town that is relatively isolated from the rest of the community. One day when Danny is buying groceries for her dysfunctional family, she watches the cars go by on the highway, wishing that one of them can transport her away. She meets Gary, a young man to whom she is instantly attracted and in one night discovers love and horror under the bridge.

results.title: The Bride with white hair
results.brief_description: Directed with exuberant energy by Ronnie Yu (“Bride of Chucky”), “The Bride with white hair” is a fine example of the type of genre bending movies that Hong Kong cinema is most famous for. Part Romeo and Juliet and part martial arts fantasy adventure, the film takes place in a mythic, medieval China and stars Hong Kong superstars Brigitte Lin and Leslie Cheung as members of opposing clans who fall in love and get caught in the middle of a violent feud. The film’s shamelessly romantic mood is set from the opening scene which has Cho Yi Hang (Leslie Cheung), a Wu Tang Clan sect disciple, forlornly guarding a single white rose believed to have mystical powers, while mourning the absence of his true love, Lian Nichang (Brigitte Lin), the white haired one of the title. The film then goes back ten years to tell their epic story, complete with evil siamese twins and plenty of hair extension fighting. Cast includes Francis Ng, Elaine Lu. Based on the novel by Leung Yu-Sang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Bride of Frankenstein
results.creator_credit: Carl Laemmle, Universal Pictures and James Whale
results.brief_description: Using the device of a prologue in which Mary Shelley takes up her story, the monster and Frankenstein were resurrected at Universal’s behest. Although the threads of continuity in the plot are explicit, in tone this is not really a sequel but a macabre comedy, an excursion into the fantastic which hovers between expressionism and surrealism. Karloff’s monster is the only sympathetic character. The mad scientist, Dr. Pretorius, seems to take over the evil presumptions of Frankenstein. As originally conceived, the heart of Frankenstein’s bride, Elizabeth, was to have been implanted in the she-monster. This makes more sense of the title and the she-monster’s behaviour. Suggested by the original story written in 1816 by Mary Wollstonecroft Shelley. Also includes a comprehensive documentary detailing various aspects of the production, including music, make-up, and behind-the-scenes information.

results.title: The Bribe
results.creator_credit: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: It took the bribe of a new phone by her mother to convince Ashlea to go on a Legacy camp. As much as she missed her father, she didn’t want his death to define her. At the camp, Ashlea started to make friends and became a member of Legacy, which she has been a part of ever since.

results.title: The Bremen town musicians
results.brief_description: A puppet animation story of a cat, a dog, a rooster and a donkey. When they are told they are too old to work, they decide to run away to become musicians. At night they come upon a robbers hideout where they scare the robbers away and decide to live in the cottage. The robbers return, but the animals scare them away and live happily ever after. This film is recommended to children between the ages of 7-11.

results.title: The Breath of Life
results.creator_credit: Karl Sabbagh, Antenne-2, Goldcrest and Stuart Urban
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
An instructional training film showing the correct methods of applying mouth-to-mouth resuscitation in cases of drowning, electrocution and suffocation. The Holger-Nielson method of resuscitation is also shown in case the mouth-to-mouth method cannot be used.

results.title: The Breath of life
results.creator_credit: Ampol Petroleum Ltd, Visatone (Australia) and Bewick Hack
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of mouth to mouth or mouth to nose resuscitation in cases of apparent drowning, suffocation and electric shock. Shows how these conditions may occur, and demonstrates resuscitation technique.
